title: Paul Ince slams Man Utd target Declan Rice's £80m price tag as 'ridiculous'
text:

Paul Ince has slammed the £80million price tag touted for Manchester United target Declan Rice as 'ridiculous'.

West Ham midfielder Rice is believed to be on a shortlist of players United want to sign as they bid to address deficiencies in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's squad.

But Ince, who himself made a controversial move from West Ham to United in 1989, reckons London Stadium is the best place for 20-year-old England ace Rice to continue his development.

"I don’t think they’ll spend £80m on Declan Rice, that’s for sure, at this moment in time,’ he told TalkSport.

"You’ve got to remember he was a centre-half and as a midfield player, I’ve watched quite a lot of him this year, he’s still got a long way to go.

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

"I think he’s at the right club at West Ham. He’s playing week in, week out, which is important, and I think he’s got the right people around him, like Mark Noble, who has been there a long time, so he’ll learn a lot.

"But stop quoting these ridiculous prices, it’s madness, it really is."

Ince had some advice as to how Rice could improve, saying: "In two or three years' time, maybe, but he’s still got a lot to learn, he’s still got to grow, be a lot more powerful and get up and down the park quicker than he does.

(Image: Sunday Mirror)

"That will come as his body develops more but he’s still got to get himself in the box, got to score goals. That’s going to be worth £80-90m, so if he can learn that as he grows older, why not?"

Other players said to be United targets include Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic, Aston Villa midfielder John McGinn, Leicester attacking midfielder James Maddison, Bournemouth striker Callum Wilson, Lyon forward Moussa Dembele and Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitic.
description: Former United and West Ham midfielder Ince reckons London Stadium is still the right place for 20-year-old Rice
